Each segment has 20 Hit Points, 15 Damage Reduction, and takes damage as if it was Psychic Typed.

name: Electro Ball
effect: The user adds their Speed Stat, including Combat Stages, in addition to their Special Attack when determining the damage dealt by Electro Ball. The Defender in turn subtracts both their Special Defense and Speed Stats from the damage dealt before applying Type Effectiveness.

name: Electro Drift
effect: After dealing damage, the user may Disengage 4 meters in a straight line. Whenever this Move deals Super-Effective Damage to a target, that target treats your Damage Roll as if it was increased by +10.

name: Electro Shot
effect: For 1 round, any ally that enters a square adjacent to the user, or starts movement there, may Disengage into any square of the Area of Effect of this Move without expending Movement, and then continue their Shift. If the user is in Rainy Weather, this Move is a Standard Action.

name: Electroweb
effect: All Legal Targets are lowered 1 Speed Combat Stage.

name: Embargo
effect: The target cannot use or benefit from held items for the remainder of the encounter. Embargo may only affect one target at a time; if Embargo is used on a new target, the previous target is freed from the effect.

name: Ember
effect: Ember Burns the target on 18+.

name: Encore
effect: Roll 1d6. On a result of 1 or 2, the target becomes Confused; on a result of 3 or 4 the target becomes Suppressed; on a result of 5 or 6 the target becomes Enraged.

name: Endeavor
effect: The target loses a Tick of Hit Points for each Injury the user has.

name: Endure
effect: If the user is hit by a damaging Move, you may use Endure as a Free Action. If the Move would bring Endure’s user down to 0 Hit Points or less, Endure’s user instead is set to 1 Hit Point.

name: Energy Ball
effect: Energy Ball lowers the foe’s Special Defense 1 Combat Stage on 17+.

name: Entrainment
effect: The target gains one of the user’s Abilities for 3 turns.

name: Eruption
effect: For each 10% of Hit Points the user is missing, Eruption’s Damage Base is reduced by 1. Eruption creates a 1 meter burst, but also affects an area 10 meters tall straight up.

name: Esper Wing
effect: Esper Wing is a Critical Hit on an 18+.

name: Expanding Force
effect: After Expanding Force is resolved, you may create Psychic Terrain in a Blast 7, centered on the user, that lasts for 5 turns. Any creatures in those spaces are affected as if by the Field Move Psychic Terrain, rather than any other Field Move. This Effect may trigger only once per Scene.

name: Explosion
effect: The user’s Hit Points are set to -50% of their full Hit Point value. This Hit Point loss cannot be prevented or reduced in any way. The user’s loyalty toward its trainer may be lowered.

name: Extrasensory
effect: Extrasensory Flinches the target on 19+.

name: Extreme Speed
effect: None

name: Fairy Lock
effect: All legal targets become Trapped and Slowed while the user remains in the encounter. This effect ends if the user switches or is Fainted.

name: Fairy Wind
effect: None

name: Fake Out
effect: You may only use Fake Out with Priority upon joining an encounter; if you do, Fake Out Flinches the target. Switching out resets the requirement of joining an encounter.

name: Fake Tears
effect: Lower the target’s Special Defense 2 Combat Stages.

name: False Surrender
effect: False Surrender cannot miss.

name: False Swipe
effect: False Swipe’s damage cannot bring a target lower than 1 Hit Point.

name: Façade
effect: If the user is afflicted with a Persistent Status Affliction, Façade’s Damage Base is doubled to DB 14 (4d10+15 / 40).

name: Feather Dance
effect: All legal targets have their Attack lowered 2 Combat Stages.

name: Feint
effect: If a foe uses a Move with the Shield Keyword in response to one of your actions, you may activate Feint to cause the triggering Move to Fail. Feint is activated as a Free Action.

name: Feint Attack
effect: Feint Attack cannot miss.

name: Fell Stinger
effect: If the user successfully knocks out a target with Fell Stinger, raise their Attack by 2 Combat Stages.

name: Fey Wild* [Superpower]
effect: The user’s Defense and Special Defense are each lowered by -1 Combat Stage.

name: Fickle Beam
effect:
Roll Accuracy for this Move 3 times. For each target, if one of these rolls succeeds, this Move hits that target. For each successful roll after the first, choose one of the following additional effects:
» That target is Slowed for 1 full round.
» That target is Suppressed.
If one or more of the rolls crit, this Move is a Critical Hit. This Move is 1 step more effective against targets that have hit the user for Super Effective damage since the beginning of their last turn.

name: Fiery Dance
effect: If Fiery Dance successfully hits a foe, it raises the user’s Special Attack by 1 Combat Stage on Even- Numbered Rolls.

name: Fiery Wrath
effect: Fiery Wrath Flinches the target on a 17+. Once per Scene, Fiery Wrath may instead be used as a Fire- Type Move.

name: Fillet Away
effect: The next successful damaging Psychic attack made by the user is automatically a Critical Hit. The user may sacrifice three Ticks of Hit Points. If they do so, choose one: » Fillet Away becomes a Swift Action. » An adjacent Ally gains 3 Ticks of Temporary Hit Points.

name: Final Gambit
effect: Final Gambit lowers the user to 0 Hit Points and causes them to Faint. Final Gambit then deals 1 point of damage to the target for every Hit Point lost by the user. Final Gambit does not cause items to activate.

name: Fire Blast
effect: Fire Blast burns the target on 19+.

name: Fire Fang
effect: Fire Fang Burns or Flinches on 18-19 during Accuracy Check; flip a coin to determine whether the foe gets Burned or Flinches. On 20 during Accuracy Check, the foe is Burned and Flinches.

name: Fire Lash
effect: The target’s Defense is lowered by 1 Combat Stage.

name: Fire Pledge
effect: If an ally uses Grass Pledge or Water Pledge, you may use Fire Pledge as Priority (Advanced) immediately after their turn to target the same foe. If used in conjunction with Grass Pledge, Fire Hazards are created in a Burst 1 around the target. If used in conjunction with Water Pledge, a Rainbow is created that lasts for 5 rounds. Consult the Pledge keyword for additional details.

name: Fire Punch
effect: Fire Punch Burns the target on 19+ during Accuracy Check.

name: Fire Spin
effect: The target is put in a Vortex.

name: First Impression
effect: You may only use First Impression with Priority upon joining an encounter; if you do, First Impression Flinches the target. Switching out resets the requirement of joining an encounter.

name: Fishious Rend
effect: Against targets with a lower initiative that have not yet acted this round, Fishious Rend deals +10 damage.

name: Fissure
effect: Roll 1d100. This roll may not be modified in any way. If you roll X or lower, the target Faints. X is equal to 30 + The User’s Level - The Target’s Level.

name: Flail
effect: For each Injury the user has, Flail’s Damage Base is increased by +1.

name: Flame Burst
effect: Any Trainers or Pokémon cardinally adjacent to the target lose 5 Hit Points.

name: Flame Charge
effect: Raise the user’s Speed 1 Combat Stage.

name: Flame Wheel
effect: Flame Wheel Burns the target on 19+.

name: Flamethrower
effect: Flamethrower Burns the target on 19+.

name: Flare Blitz
effect: Flare Blitz Burns the target on 19+.

name: Flash
effect: The Accuracy of all Legal Targets is lowered by -1.

name: Flash Cannon
effect: Flash Cannon lowers the target’s Special Defense by 1 Combat Stage on 17+.

name: Flash Step* [New]
effect: This Move cannot miss. Before attacking, the user may Teleport 4 into a square adjacent to a foe as a Shift Action.

name: Flatter
effect: The target’s Special Attack is raised by +1 Combat Stage. Flatter Confuses the target.

name: Fleur Cannon
effect: Lower the user’s Special Attack 2 Combat Stages after damage.

name: Fling
effect: The user throws a held item, determining the effect of Fling.

name: Flip Turn
effect: If Flip Turn successfully hits its target, the user deals damage and then immediately is returned to its Poké Ball in the same turn. A New Pokémon may immediately be sent out. Using Flip Turn lets a Trapped user be recalled.

name: Floral Healing
effect: The target regains Hit Points equal to half of its full Hit Point value. If the field is Grassy Terrain, the target gains 2/3 of its full Hit Point value instead.

name: Flower Shield
effect: All Grass Type Pokémon in Flower Shield’s area of effect have their Defense raised by +2 Combat Stages.

name: Flower Trick
effect: This Move cannot miss. If this Move hits, it is a Critical Hit.

name: Fly
set_up_effect: The user is moved up 25 meters into the air.
resolution_effect: The user may shift twice while in the air, using their overland or sky speed, and then comes down next to a legal target, and attacks with Fly.

name: Flying Press
effect: Flying Press may deal Flying Type damage if the user wishes.

name: Focus Blast
effect: Focus Blast lowers the target’s Special Defense 1 Combat Stage on 18+.

name: Focus Energy
effect: The user becomes Pumped. While Pumped, the user’s Critical Range is extended by 2, or 18+ if the Critical Range is not otherwise extended. Being switched will cause this effect to end.

name: Focus Punch
effect: Use of Focus Punch must be declared as a Priority (Limited) action at the beginning of the round. Nothing happens at this time. At the end of the round, if the target hasn’t been hit by an attack dealing damage equal to at least 25% of the user’s Maximum Hit Points, the user may Shift and use Focus Punch. Focus Punch’s Frequency is not expended if it is negated by an attack.

name: Follow Me
effect: Until the end of the user’s next turn, all Foes must target the user when using a Move that targets their opponents. This effect ends if the user is Fainted or Switched out.

name: Force Palm
effect: Force Palm Paralyzes the target on 18+.

name: Foresight
effect: Foresight may be activated as a Swift Action on the user’s turn. For the rest of the turn, the user’s Normal-Type and Fighting-Type Moves can hit and affect Ghost-Type targets, and the user can see through the Illusion Ability, Moves with the Illusion keyword, and effects created by the Illusionist Capability, ignoring all effects from those.

name: Forest’s Curse
effect: The target gains the Grass Type in addition to its other Types for 5 turns.

name: Foul Play
effect: The target reveals its Attack stat. When calculating damage, add the target’s Attack stat instead of the user’s Attack stat.

name: Freeze Shock
set_up_effect: The user may shift, then ends their turn.
resolution_effect: The user uses Freeze Shock. Freeze Shock paralyzes on 15+.

name: Freeze-Dry
effect: When calculating Weakness and Resistance for Freeze-Dry, Water-Typed targets calculate damage as if Water was weak to Ice.

name: Freezing Glare
effect: Freezing Glare Freezes the target on a 19+. Once per Scene, Freezing Glare may instead be used as an Ice-Type Move.

name: Frenzy Plant
effect: None

name: Frost Breath
effect: If Frost Breath hits, it is a Critical Hit.

name: Frustration
effect: Frustration’s Damage Base is equal to 9 minus the user’s Loyalty Value. Using Frustration may make your Pokémon dislike you.

name: Fury Attack
effect: None

name: Fury Cutter
effect: If Fury Cutter is used successfully and consecutively on the same target, the Damage Base is increased by +4 to a maximum of 16. For example, the first hit would have a DB of 4; the second hit a DB of 8; the third hit a DB of 12; the fourth and further hits a DB of 16. If Fury Cuter misses or fails to damage its target, its Damage Base resets.

name: Fury Swipes
effect: None

name: Fusion Bolt
effect: If Fusion Flare was used this round or last round by any participant of the encounter, Fusion Bolt has its Damage Base increased by +3.

name: Fusion Flare
effect: If Fusion Bolt was used this round or last round by any participant of the encounter, Fusion Flare has its Damage Base increased by +3.

name: Future Sight
effect: Future Sight does nothing on the turn it is used. At the end of the user’s next turn, Future Sight hits, even if the user is no longer on the field. Future Sight cannot miss.

name: Gastro Acid
effect: The target’s Ability is disabled until the end of the encounter. If the target has more than one Ability, you choose one of them to disable.

name: Gear Grind
effect: None

name: Gear Up
effect: All targets that are Steel-Typed receive +1 Attack and Special Attack Combat Stages

name: Geomancy
set_up_effect: The user may not shift this round. The user may create as many squares of Rough Terrain as it wants within a Burst 3 as plants burst through the ground, regardless of the surface material.
resolution_effect: The user raises its Special Attack, Special Defense, and Speed by 2 Combat Stages each.

name: Giga Drain
effect: After the target takes damage, the user gains Hit Points equal to half of the damage they dealt to the target.

name: Giga Impact
effect: None

name: Gigaton Hammer
effect: After dealing damage, the user becomes Slowed and Vulnerable until the end of their next turn.

name: Glacial Lance
effect: Legal targets hit by Glacial Lance are Stuck and Trapped until the end of their next turn.

name: Glaciate
effect: All Legal Targets have their Speed lowered 1 Combat Stage. On an Even-Numbered Roll, all Legal Targets on the ground are Slowed.

name: Glaive Rush
effect: On hit, you may choose to become Vulnerable for 1 full round. If you do, this attack is one step more effective. Additionally, the next successful damaging attack against you while Vulnerable this way is automatically a Critical Hit.

name: Glare
effect: Glare Paralyzes the target.

name: Glint* [Chilling Water]
effect: The target cannot make Attacks of Opportunity for 1 full round and their Attack is lowered by -1 Combat Stage.

name: Grass Knot
effect: Grass Knot’s Damage Base is equal to twice the target’s Weight Class.

name: Grass Pledge
effect: If an ally uses Fire Pledge or Water Pledge, you may use Grass Pledge as Priority (Advanced) immediately after their turn to target the same foe. If used in conjunction with Fire Pledge, Fire Hazards are created in a Burst 1 around the target. If used in conjunction with Water Pledge, the target and all foes adjacent to the target are slowed and have their Speed reduced by 2 Combat Stages. Consult the Pledge keyword for additional details.

name: Grass Whistle
effect: The target falls Asleep.

name: Grassy Glide
effect: If the user is on Grassy Terrain, Grassy Glide may be used with Priority. After Grassy Glide has been resolved, the user may choose to create Grassy Terrain in the spaces Passed over (including those it started and ended in), that lasts for 5 turns. Any creatures in those spaces are affected as if by the Field Move Grassy Terrain, rather than any other Field Move.

name: Grassy Terrain
effect: The area becomes Grassy for 5 rounds. While Grassy, all Pokémon and Trainers standing on the ground recover a Tick of Hit Points at the start of every turn, and Grass-Type attacks performed by grounded Pokémon and Trainers gain a +10 bonus to Damage Rolls.

name: Grav Apple
effect: The target’s Defense is lowered by 1 CS.

name: Gravity
effect: For 5 rounds, the area is considered Warped. While Warped, Moves that involve the user being airborne may not be used. Pokémon cannot use Sky or Levitate Capabilities to end their turn at an altitude higher than 1 meter. Flying-Types and Pokémon with the Ability Levitate are no longer immune to Ground- Type Moves. All Accuracy Rolls receive a +2 Bonus.

name: Growl
effect: Growl lowers all Legal Targets Attack 1 Combat Stage.

name: Growth
effect: Raise the user’s Attack 1 Combat Stage and raise the user’s Special Attack 1 Combat Stage. If it is Sunny, double the amount of Combat Stages gained.

name: Grudge
effect: You may use Grudge as an Interrupt when a Damaging Attack causes the user to faint. Grudge is activated as a Free Action (does not take up a Command). The attack is resolved as usual, and the user Faints. The attacker that caused the user to Faint becomes Suppressed for the remainder of the encounter; switching and Taking a Breather does not end Suppression when used this way.

name: Guard Split
effect: The target loses 5 Defense and 5 Special Defense. If they do, the user gains 5 Damage Reduction. These effects last until the end of the scene.

name: Guard Swap
effect: The user and the target trade Combat Stage values for the Defense Stat, and then for the Special Defense Stat.

name: Guillotine
effect: Roll 1d100. This roll may not be modified in any way. If you roll X or lower, the target Faints. X is equal to 30 + The User’s Level - The Target’s Level.

name: Gunk Shot
effect: Gunk Shot Poisons the Target on 15+.

name: Gust
effect: If the target is airborne as a result of Fly or Sky Drop, Gust can hit them, ignoring Range and has a Damage Base of 8 instead.

name: Gyro Ball
effect: The target reveals their Speed Stat (including Combat Stages). If it is higher than the user’s (again, including Combat Stages), subtract the user’s Speed Stat from the target’s, and apply the difference as Bonus Damage.

name: Hail
effect: The weather changes to Hail for 5 rounds. While it is Hailing, all non-Ice Type Pokémon lose a Tick of Hit Points at the beginning of their turn.

name: Hammer Arm
effect: The user lowers their Speed 1 Combat Stage.

name: Hard Press
effect: If the target’s Hit Points are above 50%, this Move’s Damage Base is doubled to Damage Base 12 (3d12+10 / 30).

name: Harden
effect: Raise the user’s Defense 1 Combat Stage.

name: Haze
effect: The Combat Stages of the user and all Pokémon and Trainers in the encounter are set to their default state (usually 0).

name: Head Charge
effect: The target is Pushed back 2 meters.

name: Head Smash
effect: The target is pushed 2 meters.

name: Headbutt
effect: Headbutt Flinches the target on 15+.

name: Headlong Rush
effect: The user’s Defense and Special Defense are each lowered by -1 Combat Stage. Headlong Rush may be used as a Free Action at the end of a Sprint Maneuver taken as a Standard Action, as long as the user Shifted at least 3 meters in a straight line towards the target. When used this way, Headlong Rush Trips the target on a hit.

name: Heal Bell
effect: All targets are cured of any Persistent Status ailments.

name: Heal Block
effect: Until the end of the encounter, the target may not gain Hit Points or Temporary Hit Points from any source. This effect ends if the target is switched out or Takes a Breather.

name: Heal Order
effect: The user regains Hit Points equal to half of its full Hit Point value.

name: Heal Pulse
effect: Restores 50% of the target’s max Hit Points. Heal Pulse’s user may not target itself with Heal Pulse.

name: Healing Wish
effect: The user immediately Faints, lowering its HP to 0. The user takes no Injuries from HP Markers when using Healing Wish. The target is immediately cured of up to 3 injuries, healed to their Maximum Hit Points, and has the Frequency of all Moves restored. Healing Wish may target a Pokémon in a Poké Ball. Healing Wish does not restore the Frequency of Healing Wish or Lunar Dance. Injuries healed through Healing Wish count toward the total number of Injuries that can be healed each day, and this healing is limited by the same.

name: Heart Stamp
effect: Heart Stamp Flinches the target on 15+.

name: Heart Swap
effect: The targets trade Combat Stage values for each Stat.

name: Heat Crash
effect: For each weight class the user is above the target, increase Heat Crash’s Damage Base by +2.

name: Heat Wave
effect: Heat Wave Burns all Legal Targets on 18+.

name: Heavy Slam
effect: For each weight class the user is above the target, increase Heavy Slam’s damage base by +2.

name: Helping Hand
effect: Helping Hand grants the target +2 on their next Accuracy Roll this round, and +10 to the next Damage Roll this round.

name: Hex
effect: Once a Scene, if Hex’s target has a Status Affliction, you may have Hex’s Damage Base be 13 instead (4d10+10 / 35).

name: Hidden Power
effect: When a Pokémon first obtains the Move Hidden Power, roll 1d20. Hidden Power’s Elemental Type will be changed from Normal to Bug on a result of 1; Dark on 2; Dragon on 3; Electric on 4; Fairy on 5; Fighting on 6; Fire on 7; Flying on 8; Ghost on 9; Grass on 10; Ground on 11; Ice on 12; Normal on 13; Poison on 14; Psychic on 15; Rock on 16; Steel on 17; Water on 18; and on 19 or 20, reroll until you roll another number. This effect is permanent –if Hidden Power is forgotten and relearned, the chosen Type remains the same.

name: High Horsepower
effect: High Horsepower may be used as a Free Action at the end of a Sprint Maneuver taken as a Standard Action, as long as the user Shifted at least 3 meters in a straight line towards the target. When used this way, High Horsepower gains Smite.

name: High Jump Kick
effect: If High Jump Kick misses, the user loses Hit Points equal to 1/4th of their Max Hit Points. A failure to hit due to a Move with the Shield keyword does not count as a miss. This Move cannot be used if Gravity is in effect.

name: Hold Hands
effect: Both the user and the target become Cheered. They may give up the Cheered condition when making a Save Check to roll twice and take the best result.

name: Hone Claws
effect: The user’s Accuracy is raised by +1, and the user gains +1 Attack Combat Stage.

name: Horn Attack
effect: None

name: Horn Drill
effect: Roll 1d100. This roll may not be modified in any way. If you roll X or lower, the target Faints. X is equal to 30 + The User’s Level - The Target’s Level.

name: Horn Leech
effect: After the target takes damage, the user gains Hit Points equal to half of the damage they dealt to the target.

name: Howl
effect: The user and all allies in the Burst have their Attack CS raised by 1.

name: Hurricane
effect: Hurricane Confuses its target on 15+. If the target is in Sunny Weather, Hurricane’s Accuracy Check is 11. If the target is in Rainy Weather, Hurricane cannot miss. If the target is airborne as a result of Fly or Sky Drop, Hurricane cannot miss.

name: Hydro Cannon
effect: None

name: Hydro Pump
effect: The target is pushed away from the user 3 meters.

name: Hydro Steam
effect: This Move does not deal reduced damage in Sunny Weather. It instead deals +10 damage in Sunny Weather. NOTE: If you are using the Weathers from Domovoi’s Rework, the [Sun Shining] Blessing may not be activated against this Move.

name: Hyper Beam
effect: None

name: Hyper Drill
effect: Blessings or Moves with the Shield keyword may not be activated in response to this Move.

name: Hyper Fang
effect: Hyper Fang Flinches the target on 19+

name: Hyper Voice
effect: All Legal Targets are pushed back to the squares immediately outside the blast, away from the user.

name: Hyperspace Fury
effect: Interrupts may not be triggered against Hyperspace Fury. The user’s Defense is lowered by -1 Combat Stage.

name: Hyperspace Hole
effect: Make and resolve of Hyperspace Hole’s attacks separately. In between each attack, the user may Shift using their Teleporter capability, ending the Shift next to a legal target. Interrupts may not be triggered against Hyperspace Hole.

name: Hypnosis
effect: The target falls Asleep.

name: Ice Ball
effect: The user continues to use Ice Ball on each of its turns until they miss any target with Ice Ball, or are not able to hit any target with Ice Ball during their turn. Each successive use of Ice Ball increases Ice Ball’s Damage Base by +3 to a maximum of DB 15.

name: Ice Beam
effect: Ice Beam Freezes on 19+ during Accuracy Check.

name: Ice Burn
set_up_effect: The user may shift, then ends their turn.
resolution_effect: The user uses Ice Burn. Ice Burn Burns on 15+.

name: Ice Fang
effect: Ice Fang Freezes or Flinches on 18+ during Accuracy Check; flip a coin to determine whether the foe gets Frozen or Flinches. On 20 during Accuracy Check, the foe is Frozen and Flinches.

name: Ice Hammer
effect: The user’s Speed is lowered by 1 Combat Stage.

name: Ice Punch
effect: Ice Punch Freezes the target on 19+ during Accuracy Check.

name: Ice Shard
effect: None

name: Ice Spinner
effect: All targets are Tripped on a roll of 18+. If the user moves through an area of Terrain, or a Field-range Terrain is active, those effects immediately end.

name: Icebreaker* [Double Edge+]
effect: You may use this Move as if it had the Priority and Pass keywords in the first round after joining an encounter. Switching out resets this requirement.

name: Icicle Crash
effect: Icicle Crash Flinches the target on 15+.

name: Icicle Spear
effect: None

name: Icy Wind
effect: All Legal Targets have their Speed lowered 1 Combat Stage.

name: Imprison
effect: The target is Locked for the rest of the Scene. A Locked target may not use any Moves the user knows. Imprison cannot miss.

name: Incinerate
effect: If a target is holding a Held Item or Main or Off- Hand item, they must either drop it immediately or lose a Tick of Hit Points. This may only cause a target to lose at most one Tick of Hit Points, no matter how many items they were holding.

name: Infernal Parade
effect: Legal targets hit by Infernal Parade are Burned on a 17+. Once a Scene, if at least one of Infernal Parade’s targets has a Status Condition, you may have Infernal Parade’s Damage Base be 12 instead (3d12+10 / 30).

name: Inferno
effect: Inferno Burns the target. Inferno ignores the target’s Evasion if there are no other combatants or Rough or Blocking Terrain within 2 meters of the target.

name: Infestation
effect: The target is put in a Vortex.

name: Ingrain
effect: Ingrain applies a Coat to the user, which has the following effect; the user cannot be pushed or pulled, and cannot be switched out. At the beginning of each of the user’s turn, the user gains a Tick of Hit Points.

name: Instruct
effect: The target immediately reuses the attack it performed last, ignoring frequency, as a Free Action. They may choose new targets for the copied attack. Instruct may not be used if the Target’s last Move was a Set-Up Move, a Trigger Move, or Instruct, or if the Target is currently affected by Exhaust.

name: Ion Deluge
effect: An ion cloud is dispersed in the targeted area. All Normal-Type Moves targeting into or originating from the area become Electric-Typed Moves.

name: Iron Defense
effect: Raise the user’s Defense 2 Combat Stages.

name: Iron Head
effect: Iron Head Flinches the target on 15+.

name: Iron Tail
effect: Iron Tail lowers the target’s Defense 1 Combat Stage on 15+.

name: Ivy Cudgel
effect: Ivy Cudgel may be any Type the user currently possesses. Ivy Cudgel is a critical hit on a roll of 18+.

name: Jaw Lock
effect: You may perform a Grapple Maneuver against the target as a Free Action.

name: Jet Punch
effect: None

name: Judgment
effect: Judgment’s Type can be whatever Elemental Type the user wants it to be.

name: Jump Kick
effect: If Jump Kick misses, the user loses Hit Points equal to 1/4th of their Max Hit Points. A failure to hit due to a Move with the Shield keyword does not count as a miss. This Move cannot be used if Gravity is in effect.

name: Jungle Healing
effect: The user and any allies in the burst regain Hit Points equal to 1/4 of their Maximum Hit Point Value, and are cured of any Persistent or Volatile Status Conditions.

name: Karate Chop
effect: Karate Chop is a Critical Hit on 17+.

name: Kinesis
effect: If the user or an Ally within 6 meters is about to be hit by an attack, the user may use Kinesis as an interrupt. The triggering Accuracy Roll receives a -4 penalty. This may cause Moves to miss.

name: King’s Shield
effect: If the user is hit by an attack, the user may use King’s Shield. The user is instead not hit by the Move. You do not take any damage nor are you affected by any of the Move’s effects. In addition, if the triggering attack was Melee ranged, the attacker’s Attack is lowered by 2 Combat Stages.

name: Knock Off
effect: Choose one of the target’s Held Items or Accessory Slot Items. It is knocked to the ground.

name: Kowtow Cleave
effect: This Move cannot miss.

name: Land’s Wrath
effect: None.

name: Laser Focus
effect: The next successful damaging attack made by the user is automatically a Critical Hit.

name: Lash Out
effect: If the user has lost CS from a source other than itself since the end of its last turn, Lash Out is instead DB 15 (4d10 + 20 / 45). Any given foe may be the target of this increased damage only once per Scene.

name: Last Resort
effect: Last Resort can only be used after the user has performed 5 other different Moves in its Move List during a single fight, without being switched out.

name: Last Respects
effect: This Move gains additional Effects depending on the number of allies that have Fainted this Scene. These Effects are cumulative. 1: The target is Flinched on 15+. 2: The target is Cursed on 17+. 3: This Move gains Smite. Once per Scene, this Move may Deal damage of a Type of any of the Fainted allies instead of Ghost. This does not affect whether this Move gains STAB or not.

name: Lava Plume
effect: Lava Plume burns all targets on 16+.

name: Leaf Blade
effect: Leaf Blade is a Critical Hit on 18+.

name: Leaf Storm
effect: Lower the user’s Special Attack 2 Combat Stages after damage.

name: Leaf Tornado
effect: Small or Medium targets in the central square of the blast are not hit. On 15+, all legal targets have their Accuracy lowered by -1.

name: Leech Life
effect: After the target takes damage, the user gains HP equal to half of the damage they dealt to the target.

name: Leech Seed
effect: At the beginning of each of the target’s turns, Leech Seed’s target loses a Tick of Hit Points. Leech Seed’s user then gains Hit Points equal to the amount the target lost. Leech Seed lasts until the target faints or is returned to a Poké Ball. Grass Types and targets immune to Grass Attacks are immune to Leech Seed.

name: Leer
effect: All legal targets have their Defense lowered by 1 Combat Stage.

name: Lick
effect: Lick Paralyzes the target on 15+ during Accuracy Check.

name: Life Dew
effect: The user and all allies in the burst regain Hit Points equal to 1/4 of their Maximum Hit Points.

name: Light Screen
effect: Blessing – Any user affected by Light Screen may activate it when receiving Special Damage to resist the Damage one step. Light Screen may be activated 2 times, and then disappears.

name: Light of Ruin
effect: None

name: Liquidation
effect: The target’s Defense is lowered by 1 Combat Stage on a 17+.

name: Lock-On
effect: The target is Locked-On. The next Move that the user uses against the Target that requires an Accuracy Check cannot miss. Lock-On’s effect, on both the User and Target, is passed on by Baton Pass.

name: Lovely Kiss
effect: The target falls Asleep.

name: Low Kick
effect: Low Kick’s Damage Base is equal to twice the target’s Weight Class.

name: Low Sweep
effect: Lowers the target’s Speed 1 Combat Stage.

name: Lucky Chant
effect: Blessing – Any user affected by Lucky Chant may activate it when receiving a Critical Hit to cause the attack to instead deal damage as if it was not a Critical Hit. Lucky Chant may be activated 3 times, and then disappears.

name: Lumina Crash
effect: The target’s Special Defense is lowered by -2 Combat Stages.

name: Lunar Blessing
effect: The user regains hit points equal to 50% of its Hit Point total, cures all of its Status conditions, and gains +2 Evasion.

name: Lunar Dance
effect: The user immediately Faints, lowering its Hit Points to 0. The user takes no Injuries from Hit Point Markers when using Lunar Dance. The target is immediately cured of up to 3 injuries, healed to their Maximum Hit Points, and has the Frequency of all Moves restored. Lunar Dance may target a Pokémon in a Poké Ball. Lunar Dance does not restore the Frequency of Healing Wish or Lunar Dance. Injuries healed through Lunar Dance count toward the total number of Injuries that can be healed each day, and this healing is limited by the same.

name: Lunge
effect: Lunge may be used as a Free Action at the end of a Sprint Maneuver taken as a Standard Action, as long as the user Shifted at least 3 meters in a straight line towards the target. When used this way, Lunge's target receives a -5 penalty to damage rolls for 1 round.

name: Luster Purge
effect: Luster Purge lowers the target’s Special Defense by 1 Combat Stage on an Even-Numbered Roll.

name: Mach Punch
effect: None

name: Magic Coat
effect: If the user is about to get a hit by a Move that does not have a Damage Dice Roll, they may use Magic Coat as an Interrupt. The Interrupted Move’s user is treated as if they were the target of their own Move, with the user of Magic Coat as the user.

name: Magic Powder
effect: The target gains the Psychic Type in addition to its other Types for 5 turns.

name: Magic Room
effect: The area becomes Useless for 5 rounds. While Useless, Pokémon may not benefit from the effects of any Held Items, and Trainers cannot benefit from any Accessory-Slot equipment. This does not affect consumable or activated items, only Items with Static effects or Triggers.

name: Magical Leaf
effect: Magical Leaf cannot miss.

name: Magical Torque
effect: Confuses all legal targets on 15+.

name: Magma Storm
effect: The target is put in a Vortex; this effect occurs even if Magma Storm misses its target.

name: Magnet Bomb
effect: Magnet Bomb cannot miss.

name: Magnet Rise
effect: The user gains the Levitate Ability for 5 turns. Magnet Rise may be activated as a Swift Action if the user is otherwise given an action that consumes a Command.

name: Magnetic Flux
effect: Choose +1 or -1. All targets that are Electric- Type or have the Magnetic Capability receive that many Defense and Special Defense Combat Stages.

name: Magnitude
effect: When you use Magnitude, roll 1d6. Magnitude’s Damage Base is equal to 5+X, where X is the value of the d6. Magnitude can hit targets that are underground, including those using the Move Dig.

name: Make It Rain
effect: The user’s Special Attack is lowered by -1 Combat Stage. Once per Day, this Move scatters metal coins equal in value to 1d8 times the user’s Level. If it is a trainer battle, the winner gets to pick up the coins.

name: Malignant Chain
effect: The target is Poisoned. Then, choose an ally. That ally and the target become Linked to each other. Whenever the Linked ally takes damage, the Linked foe loses a Tick of Hit Points. This effect ends when the user is Fainted or the Scene ends.

name: Mat Block
effect: If the user or an adjacent ally is hit by a damaging attack, the user may use Mat Block. The attack instead does not hit any targets, and it deals no damage and no has effects. You may only use Mat Block during the first round of an encounter.

name: Matcha Gotcha
effect: After the targets take damage, choose one of the targets, the user gains HP equal to half of the damage they dealt to that target. Matcha Gotcha Burns all Legal Targets on 17+.

name: Me First
effect: If an opponent declares a Damaging Attack against the user, and Me First’s user has a higher Speed stat then the target, the user may use Me First as an Interrupt. The User will then use the same Move the triggering foe was about to use on that foe.

name: Mean Look
effect: The user casts a foul spell on the target, causing it to become Trapped and Slowed for the remainder of the encounter.

name: Meditate
effect: Raise the user’s Attack 1 Combat Stage.

name: Mega Drain
effect: After the target takes damage, the user gains Hit Points equal to half of the damage they dealt to the target.

name: Mega Kick
effect: The target is Pushed 2 meters.

name: Mega Punch
effect: None

name: Megahorn
effect: The target is pushed 1 Meter.

name: Memento
effect: Memento may be used as a Free Action when the user becomes Fainted. Memento’s target has each of their stats lowered by -2 CS.

name: Metal Burst
effect: Metal Burst causes all targets in the burst to lose Hit Points equal to the total amount of direct Damage the user has taken since the beginning of this Round. Metal Burst cannot miss.

name: Metal Claw
effect: Raise the user’s Attack 1 Combat Stage on 18+.

name: Metal Sound
effect: All Legal Targets have their Special Defense lowered 2 Combat Stages.

name: Meteor Beam
set_up_effect: The user’s Special Attack is raised by +1 Combat Stage.
resolution_effect: The user attacks with Meteor Beam.

name: Meteor Mash
effect: Raise the user’s Attack 1 Combat Stage on 15+.

name: Metronome
effect: Metronome randomly uses any other Move except for After You, Assist, Bestow, Copycat, Counter, Covet, Crafty Shield, Destiny Bond, Detect, Endure, Feint, Focus Punch, Follow Me, Helping Hand, King’s Shield, Metronome, Me First, Mimic, Mirror Coat, Mirror Move, Protect, Quash, Quick Guard, Rage Powder, Sketch, Sleep Talk, Snatch, Snore, Spiky Shield, Switcheroo, Thief, Transform, Trick, and Wide Guard. The GM helps to pick the random Move.

name: Mighty Cleave
effect: The user gains +10 Damage Reduction for 1 full round. Interrupts may not be activated in response to this Move.

name: Milk Drink
effect: The target regains Hit Points equal to half of its full Hit Point value. The user may target themselves with Milk Drink.

name: Mimic
effect: Choose a Move that the target has used during the encounter. For the remainder of the encounter, that Move replaces Mimic on the user’s Move List. Mimic cannot miss.

name: Mind Blown
effect: The user’s Hit Points are reduced by 50% of their full Hit Point value. This Hit Point loss cannot be prevented or reduced in any way.

name: Mind Reader
effect: The target becomes Read to the user until the end of the user’s next turn. The user may end this effect when making an Attack on the user, causing that attack to automatically hit; OR when the Read target uses an Attack against the user, causing that attack to automatically miss. If the user has the Telepathy Capability, the user automatically succeeds on a mind- reading attempt against the target, and may listen to the target’s surface thoughts as long as they remain Read. Mind Reader automatically misses against targets with the Mindlock Capability.

name: Minimize
effect: The user gains +4 Evasion, and user’s size is lowered to Small for the remainder of the encounter.

name: Miracle Eye
effect: Miracle Eye may be activated as a Swift Action on the user’s turn. For the rest of the turn, the user’s Psychic-Type Moves can hit and affect Dark-Type targets, and the user can see through the Illusion Ability, Moves with the Illusion keyword, and effects created by the Illusionist Capability, ignoring all effects from those.

name: Mirror Coat
effect: Mirror Coat may be used as a Reaction when the user is hit by a damaging Special Attack. Resolve the Triggering Attack, with Mirror Coat’s user resisting the attack one step further. After the attack is resolved, if Mirror Coat’s user was not Fainted, the triggering foe then loses Hit Points equal to twice the amount of Hit Points lost by the user from the triggering attack. Note that Mirror Coat is Special, and while it cannot miss, it cannot hit targets immune to Psychic-Type Moves.

name: Mirror Move
effect: Use the Move the target has used on their last turn. You may choose new targets for the Move. Mirror Move cannot miss.

name: Mirror Shot
effect: All Legal Targets have their Accuracy lowered by -2 on 16+.

name: Mist
effect: Blessing – Any user affected by Mist may activate it when having Combat Stages lowered by any effect; if they do, those Combat Stages are instead not lowered. Mist may be activated 3 times, and then disappears.

name: Mist Ball
effect: Mist Ball lowers the target’s Special Attack by 1 Combat Stage on an Even-Numbered Roll.

name: Misty Explosion
effect: The user’s Hit Points are set to -50% of their full Hit Point value. This Hit Point loss cannot be prevented or reduced in any way. After Misty Explosion is resolved, create Misty Terrain in a Blast 7, centered on the user, that lasts for 5 turns. Any creatures in those spaces are affected as if by the Field Move Misty Terrain, rather than any other Field Move.

name: Misty Terrain
effect: The area becomes Misty for 5 turns. While Misty, all Pokémon and Trainers standing on the ground ignore the first turn of all Status Afflictions, and Dragon-type attacks targeting or originating from a grounded Pokémon or Trainer take a -10 Penalty to Damage Rolls.

name: Moonblast
effect: Moonblast lowers the target’s Special Attack by 1 Combat Stage on 15+.

name: Moongeist Beam
effect: This Move ignores any Abilities that would cause it to fail or miss, such as Dodge or Wonder Guard; those Abilities cannot be activated in response to Moongeist Beam.

name: Moonlight
effect: The user regains Hit Points equal to half of its full Hit Point value. If it is Sunny, the user gains 2/3 of its full Hit Point value. If it is Rainy, Sand Storming or Hailing the user gains 1/4 of their full Hit Point value.

name: Morning Sun
effect: The user regains Hit Points equal to half of its full Hit Point value. If it is Sunny, the user gains 2/3 of its full Hit Point value. If it is Rainy, Sand Storming or Hailing the user gains 1/4 of their full Hit Point value.

name: Mortal Spin
effect: This Move destroys all Hazards within a Burst 5 that were placed by foes, removes Leech Seeds, and removes the user’s Trapped or Stuck conditions. All targets that are hit are Poisoned.

name: Mould* [Hex]
effect: Once a Scene, if the target has a Status Affliction, you may have this Move’s Move’s Damage Base be 13 instead (4d10+10 / 35).

name: Mountain Gale
effect: The target is Flinched on a 15+.

name: Mud Bomb
effect: The target’s Accuracy is lowered by -1 on 16+.

name: Mud Shot
effect: The target’s Speed is lowed by -1 Combat Stage.

name: Mud Sport
effect: All targets in the burst, including the user, gain a Coat which grants them 1 Step of Resistance to Electric Type Moves. After a target has been hit by a damaging Electric Type Move, the coat is removed.

name: Mud-Slap
effect: The target’s Accuracy is lowered by -1.

name: Muddy Water
effect: As a Shift Action, the user may Move to any open square in Muddy Water’s area of effect without provoking any Attacks of Opportunity. On 16+, the Accuracy of all targets is lowered by 1.

name: Mudslide* [Rock Slide+]
effect: Choose a direction. All legal targets are Pushed 2 meters in that direction.

name: Multi-Attack
effect: Multi-Attack is the same Type as the Memory Disc, Plate, or Drive Item held.

name: Mystical Fire
effect: Mystical Fire lowers the target’s Special Attack by 1 Combat Stage.

name: Mystical Power
effect: The user receives +1 Combat Stage in their highest non-HP stat.

name: Nasty Plot
effect: Raise the user’s Special Attack 2 Combat Stages.

name: Natural Gift
effect: Refer to the Move Keywords Berry list. Natural Gift deals damage according to the Berry list and Natural Gift’s Type is also defined there. The Berry’s Digestion Buff is nullified and is not used.

name: Nature Power
effect: Nature Power uses a Move defined by the Environ keyword.

name: Nature’s Madness
effect: The target loses 1/2 of their current Hit Points.

name: Needle Arm
effect: Needle Arm Flinches the target on 15+.

name: Night Daze
effect: Night Daze lowers the target’s Accuracy by -1 on 13+.

name: Night Shade
effect: The target loses Hit Points equal to the level of Night Shade’s user. Do not apply weakness or resistance. Do not apply stats.

name: Night Slash
effect: Night Slash is a Critical Hit on 18+

name: Nightmare
effect: Nightmare can only hit Legal Targets that are Asleep. The target gains Bad Sleep.

name: No Retreat
effect: The user gains +1 CS in each stat. In addition, the user may not be recalled or switched out until the end of the Scene, and counts as Slowed for the purposes of any movement that would end further away from the nearest enemy than the user started.

name: Noble Roar
effect: Noble Roar lowers all targets’ Attack and Special Attack by 1 Combat Stage.

name: Noxious Torque
effect: Poisons all targets on 15+.

name: Nuzzle
effect: Nuzzle Paralyzes the target.

name: Oblivion Wing
effect: The user gains Hit Points equal to Oblivion Wing’s Damage Roll.

name: Obstruct
effect: If the user is hit by a Move, the user may use Obstruct. The user is instead not hit by the Move. You do not take any damage nor are you affected by any of the Move’s effects. In addition, if the triggering attack was Melee ranged, the attacker’s Defense is lowered by 2 Combat Stages.

name: Occult Razor* [New]
effect: This Move automatically Critically Hits targets at or below half of their Max Hit Points. After dealing damage, the target becomes Suppressed for 1 full round.

name: Octazooka
effect: On an Even-Numbered Roll, the target’s Accuracy is Lowered by 1.

name: Octolock
effect: The user initiates a Grapple Maneuver with the target, which automatically hits. If successful, until the user no longer has Dominance in the grapple, the target is Trapped and loses 1 CS in Defense and Special Defense at the end of each of their turns.

name: Odor Sleuth
effect: Odor Sleuth may be activated as a Swift Action on the user’s turn. For the rest of the turn, the user’s Normal-Type and Fighting-Type Moves can hit and affect Ghost-Type targets, and the user can see through the Illusion Ability, Moves with the Illusion keyword, and effects created by the Illusionist Capability, ignoring all effects from those.

name: Ominous Wind
effect: On 19+, the user has each of its stats raised by +1 Combat Stage.

name: Order Up
effect: If the user, target, an Attached Commander or a pokemon Grappled by the user has a Food Buff, you may consume one of those Buffs (ignoring its normal trigger condition), gain its effects, and this attack is one step more effective. The target cannot activate Food Buffs in response to this Move.

name: Origin Pulse
effect: None

name: Outrage
effect: After damage is dealt, the user becomes Enraged and Confused.

name: Overheat
effect: Lower the user’s Special Attack 2 Combat Stages after damage.

name: Pain Split
effect: The user and the target both lose ½ of their current Hit Points. Add the amount of Hit Points the user and the target lost together, and divide the value by 2. Both the target and the user gain Hit Points equal to this value. Do not add Injuries from Pain Split from Hit Point Markers until the full effect of the Move has been resolved. Pain Split never causes Massive Damage. Hit Point loss from Pain Split cannot be prevented in any way

name: Parabolic Charge
effect: After the targets take damage, the user gains Hit Points equal to half of the total damage they dealt to all targets.

name: Parting Shot
effect: If Parting Shot successfully hits, the target’s Attack and Special Attack stats are lowered by one Combat Stage and the user is immediately recalled in the same turn. A new Pokémon may immediately be sent out. Using Parting Shot lets a Trapped user be recalled.

name: Pay Day
effect: Pay Day scatters metal coins equal in value to 1d8 times the user’s level. If it is a trainer battle, the winner of the battle gets to pick up the coins.

name: Payback
effect: If the target hit the user with a Damaging Move on the previous turn, Payback has a Damage Base of 10 (3d8+10 / 24) instead.

name: Peck
effect: None

name: Perish Song
effect: Perish Song cannot miss. All targets, including the user, receive a Perish Count of 3. At the beginning of each of the target’s turns, their Perish count is lowered by 1. Once a Perish Count reaches 0, set the Pokémon’s Hit Points to 0. A Perish Count disappears if a target returns to their Poké Ball, Takes a Breather, or is knocked out. Perish Song never causes Massive Damage.

name: Petal Blizzard
effect: None.

name: Petal Dance
effect: After damage is dealt, the user becomes Enraged and Confused.

name: Phantom Force
set_up_effect: The user is removed from the field, and their turn ends.
resolution_effect: Phantom Force’s user appears adjacent to any legal target on the field, ignoring Movement Capabilities, and then uses Phantom Force’s attack. Phantom Force cannot be avoided by Moves with the Shield Keyword, the Dodge Ability, or similar effects, and Intercepts may not be attempted in response.

name: Photon Geyser
effect: This attack uses the highest of the user’s Attack or Special Attack Stat, though it remains a Special Move. This Move ignores any Abilities that would cause it to fail or miss, such as Dodge or Wonder Guard; those Abilities cannot be activated in response to Photon Geyser.

name: Pin Missile
effect: None

name: Plasma Fists
effect: The target’s next damaging Normal Type Move instead becomes Electric Type.

name: Play Nice
effect: Play Nice lowers the target’s Attack by 1 Combat Stage.

name: Play Rough
effect: Play Rough lowers the target’s Attack 1 Combat Stage on 17-20 during Accuracy Check.

name: Pluck
effect: Pluck takes the target’s Held Item or Accessory Slot Item and attaches it to Pluck’s user, if the user is not holding anything.

name: Poison Fang
effect: Poison Fang Badly Poisons the target on 17+.

name: Poison Gas
effect: Poison Gas Poisons all Legal Targets.

name: Poison Jab
effect: Poison Jab Poisons the target on 15+.

name: Poison Powder
effect: The target is Poisoned.

name: Poison Sting
effect: Poison Sting Poisons the target on 17+.

name: Poison Tail
effect: Poison Tail is a Critical Hit on 18+, and Poisons the target on 19+.

name: Pollen Puff
effect: Once per Scene, Pollen Puff may instead be used on an ally; when used this way, the target recovers 50% of their maximum Hit Points and the Move has the Healing keyword.

name: Poltergeist
effect: If a target is holding a Held Item or Main or Off- Hand item, they must either drop it immediately or lose a Tick of Hit Points. This may only cause a target to lose at most one Tick of Hit Points, no matter how many items they were holding. On each of the target’s subsequent turns, if it is still holding the item(s) in question it loses a Tick of Hit Points.

name: Population Bomb
effect: Roll Accuracy for this Move 3 times. If one of these rolls succeeds, this Move hits. For each successful roll after the first, choose one of the following additional effects: » The target is Vulnerable until the end of their next turn. » The target's Moves are resisted 1 step further until the end of their next turn. » This Move's damage cannot be resisted. If one or more of the rolls crit, this Move is a Critical Hit, and you may choose an additional effect.

name: Pounce
effect: After dealing damage, the target is Slowed for 1 round. A target may only be Slowed by this Move once per Scene. +1

name: Pound
effect: None

name: Powder
effect: The target is dusted with a Coat of flammable powder. If it uses a damaging Fire-Type attack, the attack is negated and instad creates a Blast 3 centered on itself as the powder explodes, and the Coat is removed. All targets within the Blast take damage equal to what the user of the Fire-Type attack would roll for the damage of their attack. This damage is Typeless or Fire- Type, whichever would be more effective.

name: Powder Snow
effect: Powder Snow Freezes all Legal Targets on 19+.

name: Power Gem
effect: None

name: Power Shift
effect: The user’s Attack stat and Defense stat are switched and the user’s Special Attack stat and Special Defense stat are switched. These changes last for the remainder of the scene, or until the user is switched out or Fainted.

name: Power Split
effect: The target has their Attack and Special Attack lowered by 5. If they do, the user gains a +5 bonus to Damage Rolls. These effects last until the end of the scene.

name: Power Swap
effect: The user and the target trade Combat Stage values for the Attack Stat, and then for the Special Attack Stat.

name: Power Trick
effect: The user’s Attack stat and Defense stat are switched for the remainder of the scene, or until the user is switched out or Fainted.

name: Power Trip
effect: This Move gains +2 to its Damage Base for every positive Combat Stage held by the user, to a maximum of DB 20.

name: Power Whip
effect: None

name: Power-Up Punch
effect: If Power-Up Punch successfully hits a target, the user’s Attack is raised by +1 Combat Stage

name: Precipice Blades
effect: None.

name: Present
effect: Roll 1d6; Present has a Damage Base equal to twice the result. On a result of 1, instead of taking damage, the target gains 20 Hit Points.

name: Protect
effect: If the user is hit by a Move, the user may use Protect. The user is instead not hit by the Move. You do not take any damage nor are you affected by any of the Move’s effects.

name: Psy Kick* [Tackle]
effect: The user may push the target up to 2 meters.

name: Psybeam
effect: Psybeam Confuses the target on 19+.

name: Psyblade
effect: This Move deals +10 damage if the user or target are in Electric Terrain.

name: Psych Up
effect: The user’s Combat Stages are changed to match the target’s Combat Stages. Psych Up cannot miss.

name: Psychic
effect: The target is Pushed 1 meter in any direction. Psychic lowers the target’s Special Defense 1 Combat Stage on 17+.

name: Psychic Fangs
effect: Light Screen, Reflect and Aurora Veil cannot be declared in response to Psychic Fangs.

name: Psychic Noise
effect: Choose a legal target. The chosen target may not gain Hit Points or Temporary Hit Points from any source, until it is switched out. This counts as a Volatile Affliction.

name: Psychic Terrain
effect: The Field becomes Weird for five rounds. While the Field is Weird, non-Flying and non- Levitating Pokémon cannot declare Priority or Interrupt Moves outside their own Initiatives. Damaging Psychic-Type attacks deal an additional 10 damage

name: Psycho Boost
effect: Lower the user’s Special Attack 2 Combat Stages after damage is resolved.

name: Psycho Cut
effect: Psycho Cut is a Critical Hit on 18+.

name: Psycho Shift
effect: The user is cured of a Status ailment and the target is given that Status ailment. Psycho Shift cannot miss. Psycho Shift can only be used if the user has a Status ailment and the target does not have the status ailment that is being transferred.

name: Psyshield Bash
effect: The user gains +5 DR for one full round.

name: Psyshock
effect: When calculating damage, the target subtracts their Defense from Psyshock’s damage instead of their Special Defense. Psyshock is still otherwise Special ( Special Evasion is used to avoid it, Mirror Coat can reflect it, etc. )

name: Psystrike
effect: When calculating damage, the target subtracts their Defense from Psystrike’s damage instead of their Special Defense. Psystrike is still otherwise Special (Special Evasion is used to avoid it, Mirror Coat can reflect it, etc.)

name: Psywave
effect: Roll 1d4; on 1 the target loses Hit Points equal to half the user’s Level; on 2 the target loses Hit Points equal to the user’s Level; on 3 the target loses Hit Points equal to 1.5x the user’s level; on 4 the target loses Hit Points equal to the user’s Level doubled. Do not apply weakness or resistance, and do not apply Stats. Do apply Immunity.

name: Punishment
effect: Punishment’s Damage Base is raised by +1 for each positive Combat Stage the target has, to a maximum of DB 12.

name: Purify
effect: The target is cured of all Permanent and Volatile Statuses. For every status removed, the user recovers a Tick of Hit Points.

name: Pursuit
effect: If the foe is fleeing or being switched out, Pursuit may be used as an Interrupt, targeting the triggering foe. When used as an Interrupt, Pursuit grants the user a +5 bonus to all Movement Speeds, and has a Damage Base of 8 (2d8+10 / 19).

name: Pyro Ball
effect: The target is Burned on 19+.

name: Quash
effect: Quash changes the target’s Initiative to 0 for the remainder of the round.

name: Quick Attack
effect: None.

name: Quick Guard
effect: If the user or an adjacent ally is targeted by a Priority or Interrupt Attack, Quick Guard may be declared as an Interrupt, causing the triggering attack to have no effect.

name: Quiver Dance
effect: Raise the user’s Special Attack, Special Defense, and Speed by +1 Combat Stage each.

name: Rage
effect: The user becomes Enraged. Until the end of the user’s next turn, if the user is Enraged, the user gains +1 Attack Combat Stage whenever they are damaged by an Damaging Move or Attack.

name: Rage Fist
effect: If the user has at least 1 Injury when using this Move, its Damage Base gets doubled to DB 10 (3d8+10 / 24). Additionally, if the user is under 50% Max HP, this Move instead becomes DB 12 (3d12+10 / 30) and cannot miss.

name: Rage Powder
effect: All targets hit by Rage Powder are Enraged. While enraged, they must shift to target the user when using a Move or Attack if the user is within reach. If the user is Fainted or Switched out, all targets hit by Rage Powder are cured of rage.

name: Raging Bull
effect: As a Free Action, the user may change this Move's Type to any Type that the user possesses. Blessings may not be activated in response to this Move.

name: Raging Fury
effect: The user becomes Enraged. Legal targets become Enraged on a 16+.

name: Rain Dance
effect: The weather becomes Rainy for 5 rounds. While Rainy, Water-Type Attacks gain a +5 bonus to Damage Rolls, and Fire-Type Attacks suffer a -5 Damage penalty.

name: Rapid Spin
effect: Rapid Spin destroys all Hazards within 5 meters, removes Leech Seeds, and removes the user’s Trapped or Stuck status. If Rapid Spin hits, the user’s speed raises 1 CS.

name: Razor Leaf
effect: Razor Leaf is a Critical Hit on 18+.

name: Razor Shell
effect: Razor Shell lowers the Target’s Defense 1 Combat Stage on an Even-Numbered Roll.

name: Razor Wind
set_up_effect: The user may not shift this round. The user whips up a whirlwind around themselves, granting +2 Evasion until the end of their next turn, and destroying any Smokescreen or Hazards on any squares they are standing on and in all squares adjacent to them.
resolution_effect: The user attacks with Razor Wind. Razor Wind is a Critical Hit on 18+.

name: Recover
effect: The user regains Hit Points equal to half of its full Hit Point value.

name: Recycle
effect: The effect of a consumable item used earlier in the encounter is used again as if it had not been destroyed. The item is still gone.

name: Redline* [New]
effect: The target may not make Attacks of Opportunity until the end of the Round. If the target has any positive Combat Stages, it loses them, and this Move is 1 step more Effective. After attacking, the user may Move up to their remaining Movement as a Free Action.

name: Reflect
effect: Blessing – Any user affected by Reflect may activate it when receiving Physical Damage to resist the Damage one step. Reflect may be activated 2 times, and then disappears.

name: Reflect Type
effect: Reflect Type changes one of the user’s Types into one Type of your choice that the target has for the rest of the scene.

name: Refresh
effect: The user is cured of all Poison, Burns, and Paralysis.

name: Relic Song
effect: All Legal Targets fall Asleep on 16+. As long as Meloetta knows Relic Song, it may change between Aria Form and Step Form as a Swift Action when using Relic Song, or as a Standard Action otherwise. Both Aria and Step Form must be statted with the same HP Stat.

name: Rest
effect: The user is set to their full Hit Point value. The user is cured of any Status ailments. Then, the user falls Asleep. The user cannot make Sleep Checks at the beginning of their turn. They are cured of the Sleep at the end of their turn in 2 rounds.

name: Retaliate
effect: Retaliate’s Damage Base is doubled to DB 14 (4d10+15 / 40) if an ally has been Fainted by a Damaging Move used by the Target in the last 2 rounds of Combat.

name: Return
effect: Return’s Damage Base is equal to 3 plus the user’s Loyalty Value.

name: Revelation Dance
effect: Revelation Dance is the same Type as the user’s primary Type (the first one listed in the Pokédex). Revelation Dance deals +5 Bonus Damage for every other Dance Move used by the user this round, to a maximum of +15.

name: Revenge
effect: When declaring Revenge, the user does nothing and may not Shift. At the end of the round, the user may shift and use Revenge. If the target has damaged the user this round, Revenge has a Damage Base of 12 (3d12+10 / 30).

name: Reversal
effect: For each Injury the user has, Reversal’s Damage Base is increased by +1.

name: Revival Blessing
effect: An ally that Fainted this Scene may use a Move as a Free Action as if they were not Fainted, originating from a square adjacent to the user. The chosen ally may be a Pokémon in a Poké Ball.

name: Rising Voltage
effect: After Rising Voltage is resolved, you may create Electric Terrain in a Blast 7, centered on the user, that lasts for 5 turns. Any creatures in those spaces are affected as if by the Field Move Electric Terrain, rather than any other Field Move. This Effect may trigger only once per Scene.

name: Roar
effect: When declaring Roar, the user does nothing and may not Shift. At the end of the round, the user Shifts and uses Roar. Targets hit by Roar immediately Shift away from the target using their highest usable movement capability, and towards their Trainer if possible. If the target is an owned Pokémon and ends this shift within 6 meters of their Poké Ball, they are immediately recalled to their Poké Ball. If that Trainer sends out a replacement, they do not lose their Pokémon turn.

name: Roar of Time
effect: All legal targets are Slowed, even if the attack misses.

name: Rock Blast
effect: None

name: Rock Climb
effect: Rock Climb Confuses the target on 17+.

name: Rock Polish
effect: Raise the user’s Speed 2 Combat Stages.

name: Rock Slide
effect: Rock Slide Flinches all Legal Targets on 17+.

name: Rock Smash
effect: Rock Smash lowers the target’s Defense 1 Combat Stage on 17+.

name: Rock Throw
effect: None

name: Rock Tomb
effect: Rock Tomb lowers the target’s Speed by -1 Combat Stage.

name: Rock Wrecker
effect: None

name: Role Play
effect: The user gains one of the target’s Abilities, chosen at random, for the remainder of the encounter. This effect ends if the user Faints or is switched out. Role Play cannot miss.

name: Rolling Kick
effect: Rolling Kick Flinches the target on 15+.

name: Rollout
effect: The user continues to use Rollout on each of its turns until they miss any target with Rollout, or are not able to hit any target with Rollout during their turn. Each successive use of Rollout increases Rollout’s Damage Base by +4 to a maximum of DB 15.

name: Roost
effect: The user regains Hit Points equal to half of its full Hit Points. If the user is a Flying Type, it loses the Flying Type until the start of their next turn.

name: Rototiller
effect: All Grass-type Pokémon in the area raise their Attack and Special Attack 1 Combat Stage.

name: Round
effect: Round’s Damage Base is equal to 6, plus +2 more for each previous use of Round by any Trainer or Pokémon this round, up to a maximum of DB12.

name: Ruination
effect: The target becomes Cursed and Vulnerable until it is switched out.

name: Sacred Fire
effect: Sacred Fire Burns the target on Even-Numbered Rolls.

name: Sacred Sword
effect: Sacred Sword cannot miss.

name: Safeguard
effect: Blessing – Any user affected by Safeguard may activate it when receiving a Status Affliction to ignore the effects of that Status Affliction on their next turn. Safeguard may be activated 3 times, and then disappears.

name: Salt Cure
effect: The target becomes Lightly Salted as a Volatile Affliction. While Lightly Salted, they lose 1 Tick of HP at the beginning of each of their turns. Water and Steel-Type Pokemon hit by Salt Cure lose 2 Ticks of HP instead.

name: Sand Attack
effect: The target is Blinded until the end of their next turn.

name: Sand Tomb
effect: The target is put in a Vortex.

name: Sandstorm
effect: The weather changes to a Sandstorm for 5 rounds. While it is Sandstorming, all non-Ground, Rock, or Steel Type Pokémon lose a Tick of Hit Points at the beginning of their turn.

name: Sandstorm Sear
effect: The target is Burned on a 15+

name: Scald
effect: Scald Burns the target on 15+.

name: Scale Shot
effect: The user’s Speed is raised 1 CS, and the user’s Defense is lowered 1 CS.

name: Scary Face
effect: The target’s Speed is lowered 2 Combat Stages.

name: Scorching Sands
effect: Scorching Sands Burns the target on 15+.

name: Scratch
effect: None

name: Screech
effect: All Legal Targets have their Defense lowered 2 Combat Stages.

name: Searing Shot
effect: Searing Shot Burns all targets on 15+.

name: Secret Power
effect: Secret Power’s effect depends on Environ. Secret Power’s effect activates on 17+.

name: Secret Sword
effect: When calculating damage, the target subtracts their Defense from Secret Sword’s damage instead of their Special Defense. Secret Sword is still otherwise Special ( Special Evasion is used to avoid it, Mirror Coat can reflect it, etc. ).

name: Seed Bomb
effect: None

name: Seed Flare
effect: All Legal Targets have their Special Defense lowered 1 Combat Stage.

name: Seismic Toss
effect: The target loses Hit Points equal to the level of Seismic Toss’ user.

name: Self-Destruct
effect: The user’s Hit Points are set to -50% of their full Hit Point value. This Hit Point loss may not be prevented or reduced in any way. The user’s loyalty toward its trainer may be lowered.

name: Shadow Ball
effect: Shadow Ball lowers the foe’s Special Defense 1 Combat Stage on 17+.

name: Shadow Bone
effect: The target’s Defense is lowered by 1 Combat Stage on a 17+.

name: Shadow Claw
effect: Shadow Claw is a Critical Hit on 18+.

name: Shadow Force
set_up_effect: The user is removed from the field, and their turn ends.
resolution_effect: Shadow Force’s user appears adjacent to any legal Target, ignoring Movement Capabilities, and then uses Shadow Force’s attack. Shadow Force cannot be avoided by Moves with the Shield Keyword, the Dodge Ability, or similar effects, and Intercepts may not be attempted in response.

name: Shadow Punch
effect: Shadow Punch cannot miss.

name: Shadow Sneak
effect: None.

name: Sharpen
effect: Raise the user’s Attack 1 Combat Stage.

name: Shed Tail
effect: If the user is hit by a Move while above 1/4th Hit Points, after being told how much damage it would deal, they may use this Move. The user is instead not hit by the triggering Move, and does not take any damage, nor are they affected by any of the Move’s effects. Instead, they lose 1/4th of their maximum Hit Points. This Hit Point loss cannot be prevented in any way. The user may then Disengage up to their full Movement as a Free Action, or be switched out, even if they are Trapped. They leave behind a Tail Token on any one square they occupied. The Tail Token counts as Rough Terrain for foes, and if an ally Shifts over it, they may remove it from the field to gain the same amount of Temporary Hit Points as the user lost when activating this Move. This Move may not be activated against Moves with the Sonic keyword.

name: Sheer Cold
effect: Roll 1d100. This roll may not be modified in any way. If you roll X or lower, the target Faints. X is equal to 30 + The User’s Level - The Target’s Level.

name: Shell Side Arm
effect: This attack uses the highest of the user’s Attack or Special Attack Stat, though this does not change the Class of the Move. In addition, if the target’s Defense is lower than its Special Defense, this attack targets Defense, becoming a Physical Move. The target is poisoned on a 17+.

name: Shell Smash
effect: Raise the user’s Attack 2 Combat Stages, raise the user’s Special Attack 2 Combat Stages and raise the user’s Speed 2 Combat Stages. Lower the user’s Defense 1 Combat Stage and lower the user’s Special Defense 1 Combat Stage.

name: Shell Trap
effect: If the user is hit by a Melee attack, they may use Shell Trap as an Interrupt.

name: Shelter
effect: The user gains +1 CS in Defense and Special Defense, and +2 Evasion.

name: Shift Gear
effect: Raise the user’s Attack 1 Combat Stage and raise the user’s Speed 2 Combat Stages.

name: Shock Wave
effect: Shock Wave cannot miss.

name: Shore Up
effect: The user regains Hit Points equal to half of its full Hit Point value. If it is Sand Storming, the user gains 2/3 of its full Hit Point value instead. If it is Sunny, Rainy or Hailing the user gains 1/4 of their full Hit Point value instead.

name: Signal Beam
effect: Signal Beam confuses the target on 19+.

name: Silk Trap
effect: If the user is hit by a Move, the user may use this Move. The user is instead not hit by the triggering Move. You do not take any damage nor are you affected by any of the Move’s effects. In addition, if the triggering Move was Melee ranged, the attacker's Speed is lowered by -2 Combat Stages and they are Slowed until the end of the user's next turn. If the target already has negative Speed Combat Stages, the target is Stuck and Trapped instead of Slowed.

name: Silver Wind
effect: On 19+, the user has each of its stats raised by +1 Combat Stage.

name: Simple Beam
effect: You choose one of the target’s Abilities. Simple Beam changes that Ability to Simple for the remainder of the encounter.

name: Sing
effect: All legal Targets fall Asleep. On a miss, Sing instead causes targets to become Slowed and suffer a -2 penalty to their Evasion until the end of the user’s next turn.

name: Sketch
effect: Sketch cannot miss. Once Sketch has been used, remove Sketch from the user’s Move list. The last Move that the target used is added to the user’s Move list permanently. Sketch may not be Interrupted or Intercepted.

name: Skill Swap
effect: The user loses one of their Abilities, selected by the user, and gains one the target’s Abilities, selected at random, for the remainder of encounter. The target loses the copied Ability, and gains the user’s lost Ability. This effect ends if either the target or the user is Switched out or Fainted, but only for that Pokémon or Trainer.

name: Skitter Smack
effect: The user Shifts up to its Overland Capability, ignoring Attacks of Opportunity, before attacking with Skitter Smack. On a hit, the target’s Special Attack is lowered 1 CS.

name: Skull Bash
resolution_effect: The user may attack with Skull Bash. The target is pushed 3 meters.

name: Sky Attack
set_up_effect: The user is moved up 25 meters into the air.
resolution_effect: The user may shift until they are next to a legal target in the encounter. They may then shift again, and pass through legal targets to attack with Sky Attack. Sky Attack Flinches a target on 17-20 during Accuracy Check.

name: Sky Drop
set_up_effect: Make Sky Drop’s Accuracy Check. If the user hits, the user and target are moved 25 meters into the air. The target forfeits their next turn, and cannot Shift or take actions until Sky Drop is resolved.
resolution_effect: Shift while in the air, and lower both the user and the target heights back to the ground. Then apply Sky Drop’s damage. If the target has a Sky or Levitate Speed, Sky Drop fails to deal damage. If the user is Fainted after the Set-Up but before the Resolution, the target falls to the ground and takes damage as if Sky Drop had a Damage Base of 3 (1d6+5/8) unless they have a Sky or Levitate Speed, in which case they take no damage.

name: Sky Uppercut
effect: Sky Uppercut may be used as an Interrupt when against a target initiating Bounce, Fly, or Sky Drop to allow the user to Shift and use Sky Uppercut. If Sky Uppercut successfully hits its target, the triggering Move fails (though the target may take their next turn normally).

name: Slack Off
effect: The user regains Hit Points equal to half of its full Hit Points.

name: Slam
effect: Slam may be used as a Free Action at the end of a Sprint Maneuver taken as a Standard Action, as long as the user Shifted at least 3 meters in a straight line towards the target. When used this way, Slam gains the Smite keyword.

name: Slash
effect: Slash is a Critical Hit on 18+.

name: Sleep Powder
effect: The target falls asleep.

name: Sleep Talk
effect: Select another of the user’s Moves at random; this turn, the user may Shift and use that Move despite being Asleep. Sleep Talk can be only be used by Sleeping targets.

name: Sludge
effect: Sludge Poisons the target on 15+.

name: Sludge Bomb
effect: Sludge Bomb Poisons the target on 15+.

name: Sludge Wave
effect: Sludge Wave Poisons targets on 19+.

name: Smack Down
effect: The target is knocked down to ground level, and loses all Sky or Levitate Speeds for 3 turns. During this time, they may be hit by Ground-Type Moves even if normally immune.

name: Smart Strike
effect: Smart Strike cannot miss.

name: Smelling Salts
effect: If the target is Paralyzed, Smelling Salt’s Damage Base is doubled to 14 (4d10+15 / 40), and cures the target of Paralysis.

name: Smog
effect: Smog Poisons the target on an Even-Numbered Roll.

name: Smokescreen
effect: Smokescreen creates a blast of Smoke that covers the target area; the Smoke persists until the end of the encounter, or until Defog or Whirlwind are used. All targets attacking from or into the Smoke receive a -3 penalty to Accuracy.

name: Snap Trap
effect: The target is trapped in a Vortex. The DC to escape the Vortex is increased by 3.

name: Snarl
effect: All Legal Targets have their Special Attack lowered 1 Combat Stage.

name: Snatch
effect: If the target uses a Self-Targeting Move, you may use Snatch. You gain the benefits of the Self-Targeting Move instead of the target.

name: Snipe Shot
effect: Snipe Shot is a Critical Hit on 18+. This Move may not be Intercepted, nor may any Abilities, Moves, or Features be activated to change this Move’s target. Any of those existing effects (such as Follow Me) fail.

name: Snore
effect: Snore Flinches all legal targets on 15+. Snore may only be used by Sleeping users.

name: Snowscape
effect: The weather changes to Snowy for 5 rounds. While it is Snowing, all Ice-Type Pokémon gain 5 Damage Reduction, or +2 to any existing Damage Reduction. NOTE: For all intents and purposes, Snowscape retroactively replaces Hail in all contexts, including Movepools and Ability effects. If you are using the Weathers from Domovoi’s Rework however, Snowscape should be replaced again with Hail from that Homebrew in anything but Name.

name: Soak
effect: The target gains the Water Type in addition to its other Types for 5 turns.

name: Soft-Boiled
effect: The target regains Hit Points equal to half of its full Hit Points. The user may target themselves with Soft-Boiled.

name: Solar Beam
set_up_effect: If the weather is not Sunny, the user’s turn ends. If the weather is Sunny, immediately proceed to the Resolution Effect instead and this Move loses the Set-Up keyword.
resolution_effect: The user attacks with Solar Beam. If the weather is Rainy, Sandstorming, or Hailing, Solar Beam’s Damage Base is lowered to 6 (2d6+8 / 15).

name: Solar Blade
set_up_effect: If the weather is not Sunny, the user gains +1 Combat Stage in Attack and Special Defense, and the user’s turn ends. If the weather is Sunny, immediately proceed to the Resolution Effect instead and this Move loses the Set-Up keyword.

name: Sonic Boom
effect: Sonic Boom causes the target to lose 15 Hit Points. Sonic Boom is Special and interacts with other moves and effects as such ( Special Evasion may be applied to avoid it, Mirror Coat can reflect it, etc. )

name: Spacial Rend
effect: Spacial Rend is a Critical Hit on Even-Numbered Rolls.

name: Spark
effect: Spark Paralyzes the target on 15+.

name: Sparkling Aria
effect: When you hit a target with Sparkling Aria, the user may choose to deal no damage and instead cure that target of Burn, Confusion, Infatuation, or Rage.

name: Spectral Thief
effect: Before rolling damage, transfer all Combat Stages on the target to the user.

name: Speed Swap
effect: The user and the target trade Initiative values.

name: Spicy Extract
effect: Choose either Attack or Special Attack. Raise the chosen Stat of the user or an ally within range by +3 Combat Stages. You cannot make the same choice twice in the same Scene.

name: Spider Web
effect: Spider Web cannot miss. The target is Stuck and Trapped. If the user is freed of the Stuck condition, they are freed of Trapped as well.

name: Spike Cannon
effect: None

name: Spikes
effect: Set 8 square meters of Spikes within your range, all 8 meters must be adjacent with at least one other space of Spikes. Spikes cause terrain to count as Slow Terrain, and a grounded foe that runs into the hazards will lose a Tick of Hit Points and become Slowed until the end of their next turn.

name: Spiky Shield
effect: If the user is hit by an attack, the user may use Spiky Shield. The user is instead not hit by the Move. You do not take any damage nor are you affected by any of the Move’s effects. In addition, if the triggering attack was Melee ranged, the attacker loses a Tick of Hit Points.

name: Spin Out
effect: This Move may be used as a Free Action at the end of a Sprint Maneuver taken as a Standard Action, as long as the user Shifted at least 3 meters in a straight line and ended in range of a target. When used this way, this Move gains the Smite keyword, and lowers the user's Speed by -2 Combat Stages.

name: Spirit Break
effect: The target’s Special Attack stat is lowered 1 CS.

name: Spirit Shackle
effect: The Target is Trapped for 2 rounds.

name: Spit Up
effect: For each Stockpiled Count the user has, Spit Up’s Damage Base is increased by +8. If the user has no Stockpiled count, Spit Up cannot be used.

name: Spite
effect: Spite may be used as a Free Action that does not take up a Command whenever the user is hit by a Move. That Move becomes Disabled for the attacker.

name: Splash
effect: Shift Action - The user may make a single Jump, adding +1 to their Long Jump and High Jump values, and gains +2 Evasion until the end of their next turn.

name: Spook* [Ember]
effect: Lower the target’s Special Defense by -1 Combat Stage on 18+.

name: Spore
effect: The target falls Asleep.

name: Spotlight
effect: Until the end of the user’s next turn, the target is Blinded and Vulnerable.

name: Springtide Storm
effect: If the user is not in Therian Forme, the user has each of its stats raised by +1 CS on a 16+. If the user is in Therian Form, the target has each of its stats lowered by -1 CS on a 16+.

name: Stealth Rock
effect: Set 4 square meters of Stealth Rock hazards within 6 meters. If a foe moves within 2 meters of a space occupied by Rocks, move at most one Rock to the offender, then destroy the Rock. When that happens, the Stealth Rock causes a foe to lose a Tick of Hit Points. Stealth Rock is considered to be dealing damage; Apply Weakness and Resistance. Do not apply stats. A Pokémon who has been hit by a Stealth Rock Hazard cannot get hit by another in the same encounter until it is returned to a Poké Ball and then sent back out.

name: Steam Eruption
effect: Steam Eruption burns all legal targets on a 15+.

name: Steamroller
effect: Steamroller Flinches the target on 15+. If the target is Small, Steamroller deals an additional +5 Damage.

name: Steel Beam
effect: The user’s Hit Points are reduced by 50% of their full Hit Point value. This Hit Point loss cannot be prevented or reduced in any way.

name: Steel Roller
range: Melee, Pass, Dash, Smite, Spirit Surge
effect: Legal targets hit by Steel Roller are Tripped on a roll of 15+. Any Hazards in spaces Passed through or adjacent to those spaces are removed (they are removed before they can affect the user).
